title: 8 Easy Ways To Add A Healthy (And Very Yummy) Twist To Your Kids’ Meal

organizations.name: shaikh i. malaysian journal of nutrition

text:
facebook 
Kids are almost always picky about their food. Getting them to eat something healthy can be the most difficult task in the world because they either want to eat the food of their own choice (which is mostly packed with sugar) or nothing at all. So, is there a solution to get them eating the good stuff, without the stress? Of course, there is! The smartest thing you can do is improvise on their favourite dishes and give them a nourishing twist. A super-easy way of making any meal healthy is by preparing these dishes with nutritious and wholesome ingredients. So while you keep them warm at home during this winter, here are some ways to prepare healthy, yet delicious dishes that your kid will enjoy for sure! 1. Banana Nut Overnight Oats Pinterest 
Give a healthy spin to your kid's daily breakfast with this fruity and nutty bowl of oats . Yummy, isn't it? This bowl of oatmeal is packed with goodness and serves as a source of long-lasting energy for your kids when they head off to school. 2. Chocolate Peanut Butter Smoothie Pinterest 
Who doesn't love chocolate and peanut butter? Peanut butter is one of the yummiest sources of protein, and chocolate, of course, is every child's favourite. Ensure that your kids get the joy of experiencing their favourite desserts with a healthy twist with this smoothie . 3. Ragi Halwa Pinterest 
Your kid's tantrum will definitely come to an end after they have this delicious bowl of ragi halwa . This might not look very delicious but it is definitely something that your kid will enjoy. With this halwa twist, you can definitely make ragi taste super awesome! 4. Corn Capsicum Sandwiches with Peanut Chutney Pinterest 
The tiffin box will always come back empty when you pack it with these corn sandwiches . Corn is a great source of vitamins and minerals and is a must in a kid's meal. What better way to ensure that they gobble up all these nutritious veggies than with these delicious sandwiches? A dose of peanut chutney with a scoop of PediaSure's Badam variant will be awesome to go with. 5. Whole Wheat Pancakes Pinterest 
Pancakes and cakes are all-time favourites with kids. These fresh, hot whole wheat pancakes layered with some blueberries and maple syrup will definitely become your kid's favourite snack soon. The amount of fiber is very high in whole wheat, which makes it a healthy snack dish which can be had to their heart's content. 6. Quinoa Apple Kheer Pinterest 
This superfood bowl of kheer will win you the title of 'best mommy' for sure. Packed with the goodness of quinoa which is one of the healthiest grains, this delicious kheer with a hint of apple is something your kid will love to have every day after a nice meal. 7. Sitaphal Lassi Pinterest 
Kids actually look forward to the evening snacks. Trust us, they won't complain when you serve them this glass of thick lassi enriched with sitaphal. Definitely, this is an easy way to make kids have dairy products! 8. Glass of PediaSure with Cookies Pinterest 
For those 7 am chilly mornings, your child needs a power breakfast to avoid falling sick often! A glass of PediaSure (5 scoops in 190ml water or 2 scoops in 150ml milk) can help in supporting fussy eater's immunity during this time. Some delicious home-made cookies would be great to go along. 
Sounds yummy, right? With these awesome dishes, you are surely taking a step towards making your child healthier and stronger. Another way to keep your child healthy is by protecting him/her against infections. After all, it is a known fact that better immunity is equal to better growth*. So, here's a secret recipe which every caring mom needs in her kitchen. Sprinkle PediaSure to any of their favourite foods (when it is less than 35 degree Celsius), to add some extra nutrition to that serving! 
PediaSure is a scientifically formulated nutritional supplement for fussy eaters above 2 years, packed with 37 nutrients that help support growth, immunity and brain development. It has also shown to reduce chances of infection, and increases growth by 50% in your fussy eaters when consumed as advised. The best part is that it comes in 3 interesting flavours- Vanilla Delight, Premium Chocolate, and Kesar Badam. Add PediaSure and make these dishes extra healthier for your kids. (Please note: PediaSure is not meant for those who are lactose intolerant). 
Come on mommies, it's time to make your child eat healthy and grow healthy! *Less infection refers to less chance/incidence of upper respiratory tract infections. Depiction of growth.
